p: The EC could assess the study proposal before the emergency has occurred and decide who could be an acceptable Legally Acceptable Representative (LAR) in the absence of authorized LARs.[ 9] If it is not possible to obtain consent of the participant or LAR, for example, family members infected and hospitalized, the informed consent could be administered to the participant/LAR at a later stage when the situation improves. However, this must be done only if the EC has given prior approval.[ 9]
